clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise Capacity in Diseases and Health
clinical_study.official_title: Exercise Capacity in Diseases and Health

brief_summary.textblock:
Exercise capacity is a key factor to evaluate and treat patients in different diseases (e.g. ischemic heart disease, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, cystic fibrosis). The best way to measure exercise capacity is to perform a cardiopulmonary exercise testing. Normal/reference values in health and disease relate to specific population and subpopulations. The population in Israel is unique in its diversity.
Objectives: Data collection of exercise capacity assessment in health and illness in the northern of Israel for future local database.
Population: 500 Patients evaluated routinely in the exercise lab (pediatric cardiology institute) and healthy volunteers evaluated as controls.
Study design: Prospective observational study. Participants will answer a health related questioner, undergo a physical examination, perform a cardiopulmonary exercise test on a treadmill or a cycle ergometer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ability to complete full exercise evaluation (including cardiopulmonary exercise testing).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute illness on visit day.
- for healthy volunteers: chronic disease or use of medications.
- Professional athletes.
